sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Investors with Losses on their Investment in Open Lending Corporation of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadlines - LPRO
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP has filed a class action lawsuit against Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO) on behalf of investors who suffered losses. The lawsuit stems from Open Lending's inability to file its 2024 Annual Report on time due to issues with profit share revenue and subsequent reports of negative quarterly revenue caused by heightened delinquencies. These events led to significant drops in Open Lending's stock price and a change in its executive leadership.

feed.title: INVESTOR DEADLINE APPROACHING: Faruqi & Faruqi, LLP Investigates Claims on Behalf of Investors of Open Lending
feed.summary: Faruqi & Faruqi, LLP is investigating potential claims against Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO) and encourages investors who suffered losses exceeding $75,000 to contact them before the June 30, 2025 deadline to seek the role of lead plaintiff. The investigation centers on allegations that Open Lending made false and misleading statements regarding its risk-based pricing models, profit share revenue, and the performance of its vintage loans, which led to significant stock price drops in March and April 2025. Investors are urged to contact Faruqi & Faruqi to discuss their legal rights.

feed.title: Open Lending Shares Face Pressure Amid Strategic Shift
feed.summary: Open Lending shares recently declined by 4.7% to $1.61 amidst significant volatility and a strategic shift towards credit union partnerships. The company reported a Q3 2025 net loss of $7.6 million, a sharp reversal from the previous year, driven by a 13% drop in certified loan volumes. Analysts show varied sentiment, with an average 12-month price target of $2.92, while insiders have shown some confidence through recent share acquisitions.

feed.title: Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ:LPRO) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" by Brokerages
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ:LPRO) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from nine brokerages, with an average 1-year price target of $2.9167. The company's stock recently opened at $1.61, and reported earnings per share of $0.03 for the last quarter, surpassing analyst estimates. Insider Matthew Sather recently increased his holdings in the company, and institutional investors own a significant portion of the stock.

feed.title: Open Lending (NASDAQ:LPRO) Stock Price Down 4.7% - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Open Lending (NASDAQ:LPRO) stock fell 4.7% to $1.61 on Friday, with a significant increase in trading volume. This drop follows recent analyst target adjustments, with Canaccord cutting its price objective from $7 to $2, leading to a consensus "Hold" rating and a target price of $2.92. Despite beating quarterly earnings estimates, the company has a negative P/E ratio, though insider Matthew Sather recently increased his holdings by 40,000 shares.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Investors with Losses on their Investment in Open Lending Corporation of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadlines - LPRO
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP has announced a class action lawsuit against Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO) following significant stock price drops due to accounting issues and negative financial results. Investors who purchased Open Lending securities during the Class Period are encouraged to contact Pomerantz LLP to potentially serve as Lead Plaintiff by June 30, 2025. The lawsuit alleges securities fraud, stemming from the company's inability to timely file its 2024 annual report and subsequent reports of negative quarterly revenue and leadership changes.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Investigates Claims On Behalf of Investors of Open Lending Corp. - LPRO
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP is investigating potential claims on behalf of investors of Open Lending Corp. (NASDAQ: LPRO) concerning possible securities fraud or unlawful business practices. This investigation follows a significant drop in Open Lending's stock price after the company delayed filing its annual report and later disclosed a larger-than-expected Q4 2024 net loss, primarily due to a valuation allowance on deferred tax assets. Investors who purchased Open Lending securities are encouraged to contact Pomerantz LLP for more information.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Investors with Losses on their Investment in Open Lending Corporation of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadlines - LPRO
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP has filed a class action lawsuit against Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO), reminding investors who suffered losses to contact the firm by the June 30, 2025 Lead Plaintiff deadline. The lawsuit alleges securities fraud and unlawful business practices following disclosures of delayed annual reporting due to accounting issues and significant revenue reduction attributed to heightened loan delinquencies. These events led to substantial drops in Open Lending's stock price and a change in its CEO and COO.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Investors with Losses on their Investment in Open Lending Corporation of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadlines - LPRO
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP has filed a class action lawsuit against Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO) on behalf of investors who suffered losses. The lawsuit alleges securities fraud or unlawful business practices, stemming from Open Lending's inability to file its 2024 Annual Report on time and subsequent reporting of negative quarterly revenue due to heightened loan delinquencies. Investors have until June 30, 2025, to seek appointment as Lead Plaintiff in the class action.

feed.title: Levi & Korsinsky Notifies Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) Investors - Lead Plaintiff Deadline on June 30, 2025
feed.summary: Levi & Korsinsky has announced a lead plaintiff deadline of June 30, 2025, for investors who suffered losses in Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) due to alleged securities fraud between February 24, 2022, and March 31, 2025. The lawsuit claims Open Lending misrepresented its risk-based pricing models, profit share revenue, and the underperformance of its vintage loans. Investors are encouraged to contact Levi & Korsinsky to learn about their rights to potential recovery.

feed.title: Open Lending finalizes separation agreement with former chief revenue officer
feed.summary: Open Lending Corp (NASDAQ:LPRO) has finalized a separation agreement with its former Chief Revenue Officer, Matthew R. Roe, following his termination. The agreement, executed on December 2, 2025, entails a severance payment of $161,538.46 and an additional $17,458.44 for COBRA health insurance premiums. This news comes as the company also reported a net loss in its Q3 2025 financials and appointed a new board member.

feed.title: Open Lending Appoints Abhijit Chaudhary to Board of Directors
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation announced the appointment of Abhijit "Abhi" Chaudhary to its Board of Directors as a Class I director, effective November 21, 2025. Mr. Chaudhary, a seasoned fintech leader with over two decades of experience in product innovation and growth in consumer finance, will serve on the Company's Audit and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees. This appointment is expected to provide valuable perspective rooted in his deep knowledge of scaling disruptive technology and financial services businesses.

feed.title: Open Lending Corporation Appoints Abhijit Chaudhary to Board of Directors
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation has appointed Abhijit “Abhi” Chaudhary as a Class I director to its Board, effective November 21, 2025, replacing Gene Yoon. Chaudhary brings over 20 years of product leadership experience in financial services from companies like Mastercard, Pagaya, Green Dot, American Express, and Discover Card. CEO Jessica Buss highlighted his expertise in scaling technology and financial services as a valuable addition to the Board's strategic direction.

feed.title: Open Lending (NASDAQ: LPRO) Adds Fintech Leader Abhijit Chaudhary to Board of Directors
feed.summary: Open Lending (NASDAQ: LPRO) has appointed Abhijit “Abhi” Chaudhary to its Board of Directors as a Class I director, effective November 21, 2025. Mr. Chaudhary, a seasoned fintech product leader with over 20 years of experience, will serve on the Audit and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees, replacing Gene Yoon. His appointment is expected to provide valuable perspective rooted in his deep knowledge of scaling disruptive technology and financial services businesses.

feed.title: Open Lending certified loans fall 13%
feed.summary: Open Lending experienced a 13% year-over-year decrease in certified loan volume during the third quarter, totaling 23,880 loans. This decline is attributed to the fintech's decision to tighten underwriting standards and the upcoming launch of a new credit decisioning platform. The company provides underwriting parameters to lenders, allowing them to extend credit further into their customer base.

feed.title: Open Lending Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation reported its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025, highlighting strategic implementations like enhanced underwriting and the launch of ApexOne Auto. The company's financial overview shows a net loss of $7.6 million, an increase in total revenue to $24.2 million, and an adjusted EBITDA of $5.6 million compared to the previous year. They also provided a fourth-quarter outlook, expecting certified loans to be between 21,500 and 23,500.

feed.title: Open Lending Corporation to Announce Third Quarter 2025 Results and Host Conference Call on November 6, 2025
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO) announced it will release its third quarter 2025 financial results after market close on November 6, 2025, followed by a conference call at 5:00 PM ET. The company, which provides lending enablement and risk analytics solutions for financial institutions, will discuss the results via a live webcast and phone. This announcement highlights potential growth prospects and the company's commitment to transparency with investors and analysts.

feed.title: 35-Year Insurance Expert Todd Hart Joins Open Lending Board to Drive Strategic Growth
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ:LPRO) has appointed Todd C. Hart to its Board of Directors as a Class II director, effective September 25, 2025. Hart brings over 35 years of experience in the insurance and financial services industries, and will serve on the Company's Compensation and Nominating & Governance Committees, replacing Adam Clammer. His expertise in risk management and strategic transactions is expected to support Open Lending's growth strategy and enhance shareholder value.

feed.title: Class Action Lawsuit Filed: Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) - Join by June 30, 2025 – Contact Levi & Korsinsky
feed.summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) on behalf of investors who purchased securities between May 9, 2022, and November 1, 2023. Investors have until June 30, 2025, to apply to be a lead plaintiff. Levi & Korsinsky is representing the investors and encourages affected parties to contact them.

feed.title: Critical Comparison: Open Lending (NASDAQ:LPRO) and Encore Capital Group (NASDAQ:ECPG)
feed.summary: This article compares Open Lending (LPRO) and Encore Capital Group (ECPG) across several financial metrics including profitability, risk, analyst recommendations, ownership, and earnings/valuation. Open Lending is noted to have higher probable upside according to analysts and outperforms Encore Capital Group on 9 of 14 factors compared, despite having lower revenue.

feed.title: Open Lending: Incredibly Cheap And Possible Beneficiary Of Auto ABS Disruption - Seeking Alpha
feed.summary: Open Lending (LPRO) is presented as an incredibly cheap "FinTech" stock, trading at just 1.26x forward EV/Sales, with analysts forecasting a dramatic revenue recovery. The company's capital-light, high-margin model positions it as a potential beneficiary of disruptions in the auto ABS market, which could drive lenders back to its insured, balance-sheet-friendly approach. This could make Open Lending an attractive investment despite a brutal prior year.

feed.title: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC Invests $136,000 in Open Lending Corporation $LPRO
feed.summary: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC has acquired a new position in Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) valued at $136,000. This article details recent institutional investor activity in Open Lending, including significant changes in holdings by other hedge funds, and analyst ratings. Open Lending Corporation provides lending enablement and risk analytics solutions to various financial institutions.

feed.title: New Open Lending CFO starts on Aug. 18
feed.summary: Open Lending Corp. has appointed Massimo Monaco as its new chief financial officer, effective August 18. Monaco brings over two decades of executive finance leadership experience from the residential mortgage lending and financial services industries. CEO Jessica Buss highlighted Monaco's expertise and leadership as invaluable for driving growth.

feed.title: Open Lending Appoints Veteran Financial Services Executive Massimo Monaco as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation announced the appointment of Massimo Monaco as Chief Financial Officer, effective August 18, 2025. Mr. Monaco brings over two decades of executive finance leadership experience from the residential mortgage lending and financial services industries. His expertise is expected to drive the next phase of growth for Open Lending.

feed.title: Kirby McInerney LLP Urges Investors in Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) to Inquire About Their Rights in Class Action Lawsuit
feed.summary: Kirby McInerney LLP has announced a class action lawsuit filed against Open Lending Corporation (LPRO) on behalf of investors who purchased securities between February 24, 2022, and March 31, 2025. The lawsuit alleges misleading statements regarding the Company's risk-based pricing models, profit share revenue, and the underperformance of vintage loans, leading to significant stock price declines. Investors have until June 30, 2025, to apply to be lead plaintiff.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Investors with Losses on their Investment in Open Lending Corporation of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadlines - LPRO
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP has announced a class action lawsuit against Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ: LPRO) for alleged securities fraud or other unlawful business practices. Investors who purchased Open Lending securities during the Class Period have until June 30, 2025, to seek appointment as Lead Plaintiff. The lawsuit follows significant drops in Open Lending's stock price after disclosures regarding delayed financial reporting and negative revenue due to heightened delinquencies, and a change in CEO and COO.

feed.title: Open Lending Reports First Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation reported its first-quarter 2025 financial results, with total revenue decreasing to $24.4 million from $30.7 million in Q1 2024, and net income falling to $0.6 million from $5.1 million. The company facilitated 27,638 certified loans and announced a new $25 million share repurchase program to generate value for stakeholders. For Q2 2025, Open Lending expects certified loans to be between 25,500 and 27,500.

feed.title: Open Lending Postpones its Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation announced the postponement of its fourth quarter and full year 2024 earnings release and conference call, which was originally scheduled for March 17, 2025. The company filed a Form 12b-25 with the SEC to allow additional time to finalize its financial statements for the 2024 Form 10-K, which it expects to file by April 1, 2025. Open Lending plans to reschedule the conference call and disclose the new date and time once the 2024 Form 10-K is finalized.

feed.title: Open Lending Partners with CreditSnap to Help Lenders Deliver Informed Decisions, Navigate Refinance Needs
feed.summary: Open Lending has partnered with CreditSnap to enhance automotive lending and refinancing solutions for financial institutions. This integration combines Open Lending's Lenders Protection™ with CreditSnap's automation platform, offering seamless pre-qualification, firm loan underwriting, and dynamic approvals. The collaboration aims to help lenders navigate changing interest rates and provide efficient, risk-managed loan decisions.

feed.title: Near- and Non-Prime Consumers Continue to Face Barriers in the New and Used Vehicle Markets, Open Lending Research Finds
feed.summary: Open Lending's latest quarterly report reveals that near- and non-prime consumers continue to face significant challenges in both new and used vehicle markets due to low inventory, high prices, and tighter credit availability. Vehicle registrations for these borrowers decreased in used and saw minimal growth in new vehicles, contrasting with increases for prime borrowers. The research highlights the need for lenders to use alternative data and advanced risk analysis to serve these underserved but reliable consumers effectively.

feed.title: Open Lending Corporation Partners with Premier Automaker's Captive Finance Company to Expand Access for Near- and Non-Prime Consumers
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation has announced a new partnership with a premier automaker's captive finance company to implement its Lenders Protection™ program, marking its third such collaboration. This agreement aims to expand access to automotive loans for near- and non-prime consumers through automated decisioning and default insurance. The rollout is targeted for early 2025, with the collaboration designed to enhance lending efficiencies and strengthen dealer relationships in the automotive sector.

feed.title: Open Lending certifies 1 millionth contract through Lenders Protection
feed.summary: Open Lending Corp. has certified its 1 millionth contract through its Lenders Protection decisioning engine, marking a significant milestone in its mission to empower financial institutions and provide access to vehicle ownership. This achievement highlights Open Lending's efforts to assist underserved consumers and foster financial inclusion through analytics, risk-based pricing, and automated decisioning technology. CEO Chuck Jehl emphasized that this milestone represents the positive impact on one million lives and the strong relationships built with lenders and partners.

feed.title: Interim head Chuck Jehl formally named CEO of Open Lending
feed.summary: Chuck Jehl, who was serving as interim head of Open Lending, has been formally named CEO of the company. Jehl expressed confidence in Open Lending's differentiated technology solutions, strong balance sheet, and financial flexibility as foundational strengths for the company's future.

feed.title: In the wake of Open Lending Corporation's (NASDAQ:LPRO) latest US$60m market cap drop, institutional owners may be forced to take severe actions
feed.summary: Institutional owners, holding 61% of Open Lending Corporation (NASDAQ:LPRO), are facing pressure after a recent US$60m market cap drop and a 12% one-year loss. The article highlights that institutional influence on stock prices means continued weakness could force them to sell, impacting individual investors. It details the ownership breakdown, including significant stakes by Wasatch Advisors LP, T. Rowe Price Group, Inc., and The Vanguard Group, Inc., as well as insider and general public ownership.

feed.title: Open Lending taps CFO for interim CEO, COO
feed.summary: Open Lending has appointed CFO Chuck Jehl as interim CEO and COO following the resignation of CEO Keith Jezek. Jehl will continue to serve as CFO, and his compensation has been adjusted to reflect his expanded responsibilities. This leadership change occurs as the auto lending industry faces challenges but prepares for an "inevitable" recovery, with Open Lending focusing on optimizing its core business and expanding into the bank segment.

feed.title: Millennial And Gen Z Borrowers Climb The Credit Tier Ladder
feed.summary: A new study from Open Lending and TransUnion reveals that 30% of millennials and Gen Zers advanced in credit tiers within the last two years, outperforming older consumers. Despite being "thin-file borrowers," this demographic shows significant potential for upward credit mobility and customer loyalty. Financial institutions that intelligently cater to these "emerging prime" borrowers through data analysis can unlock higher-yielding loan opportunities and long-term customer relationships.

feed.title: Open Lending Named Winner of 2023 NAFCU Innovation Award
feed.summary: Open Lending Corporation has been recognized with the 2023 NAFCU Innovation Award for its enhanced Lenders Protection™ scorecard, an AI-powered tool that expands auto lending inclusivity and improves loan decisioning accuracy. This award highlights the company's commitment to empowering financial institutions to serve underserved borrowers by leveraging proprietary and third-party data to accurately assess risk. Since 2000, Open Lending has facilitated over 900,000 automotive loans valued in excess of $21 billion, demonstrating its significant impact on the automotive lending industry.

feed.title: Automation increases look-to-book ratio at Gesa CU
feed.summary: Gesa Credit Union has significantly improved its auto loan look-to-book ratio by implementing automated credit decisioning. This automation has boosted their accepted loan offers from around 60% to 90%-95%, aligning with the credit union's strategy to enhance new member experiences. As of year-end 2022, Gesa CU managed an auto portfolio of $1.99 billion.

feed.title: defi SOLUTIONS & Open Lending expand partnership to help captives
feed.summary: defi SOLUTIONS and Open Lending are expanding their partnership to assist captive finance companies in underwriting loans for near- and non-prime consumers. This collaboration integrates Open Lending’s Lenders Protection platform with defi SOLUTIONS' defi XLOS originations product, aiming to increase origination volumes beyond traditional prime financing guidelines and potentially reduce the financial impact of CECL reporting. The integration is expected to become broadly available during Q2 2022 as a core component of the new defi ORIGINATIONS platform.

feed.title: TWCBU IPO News - True Wind Capital's latest SPAC Bilander Acquisition prices $150 million IPO
feed.summary: Bilander Acquisition, a SPAC formed by True Wind Capital targeting the tech sector, successfully priced its $150 million IPO by offering 15 million units at $10 each. Each unit includes one common share and a fourth of a warrant, exercisable at $11.50. The SPAC, led by Scott Wagner and James Greene Jr., aims to acquire high-growth technology businesses valued between $750 million and $2.5 billion.

feed.title: NEBCU IPO News - True Wind Capital's tech SPAC Nebula Caravel Acquisition prices $250 million IPO at $10
feed.summary: Nebula Caravel Acquisition, a SPAC formed by True Wind Capital, successfully raised $250 million in its IPO by offering 25 million units at $10 each. The company, led by CEO Adam Clammer and Chairman James Greene Jr., aims to target technology and technology-enabled services sectors with transaction values between $750 million and $2.5 billion. It plans to list on the Nasdaq under the symbol NEBCU, with Deutsche Bank, William Blair, and Stifel serving as lead managers.
